article:
of Cyprus.]] A 'tube worm' is a worm-like sessile invertebrate that anchors its
 tail to an underwater surface and secretes around its body a mineral tube, into
 which it can withdraw its entire body.

Tube worms are found among the following taxa:
* (The phylum) Annelida (a.k.a. segmented worms) ** (The class) Polychaetea
  (a.k.a. bristle worms) *** (The order) Canalipalpata (a.k.a. bristle-footed
  annelids or fan-head worms) **** (The family) Siboglinidae (a.k.a. beard
  worms) ***** (The species) Riftia pachyptila (a.k.a. giant tube worm) *****
  (The genus) Lamellibrachia **** (The family) Serpulidae **** (The family)
  Sabellidae (a.k.a. feather duster worms)
* The phylum Phoronida (a.k.a. horseshoe worms)
* The order Microconchida (extinct tubeworms)
